characters: THE KIOSK AND FRONT GATES EXPLODE
AT THE TOP OF THE STAIRS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars filled with tourists move slowly through the checkpo into Mexico.  On the American side: clean maintained stre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But just across the border: crowds, garbage everywhere, buildings crammed together on pot holed streets.  It seem darker, more dangerous.  Everything has a touch of evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A honky tonk street lined with dives.  Neon flickers outs a strip club.  COLLEGE KIDS on Spring Break laugh drunken as they leave the club, one belches loudly. We sneak in while the doors are open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost everyone is American.  Four clean cut young men wa a pair of aging STRIPPERS gyrate on stage.  When the Ugly Stripper dances in front of them, one of them puts a doll in her G-string.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horman, why are you giving that skank money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVE DELMAR is a massive weight lifter with a troubled childhood which turned him into a bit of a bully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the closest he's been to pussy in months, Del.  Give him a break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARTIE HORMAN is the youngest of the group, and the most u of himself.  Maybe still a virgin.  Wears a tourist sombr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want me to take a picture and send it to your wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy would kill me.  Can't even rent R rated movies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICK BREEN is the most conservative: already married; dre for church, not strippers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only an idiot would get married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who you calling an idiot?  I get it at least once a week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The best looking stripper takes it all off.  Every man in the dive watches her but one: MARTY RACKIN, oldest of the four, keeps his eye on a boot in the back where a slick drug lawyer named VARGAS talks with two MEXICANS in sweat clothes and gold jewelry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey baby!  Come on down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Stripper dances to their side of the room, Vargas gives the Mexicans some hundred dollar bills, and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink up.  It's time to run and gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she's just....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard the man: Drink up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horman reluctantly ignores the stripper gyrating in front him and finishes his beer.  The four follow Vargas out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin doesn't lose sight of Vargas.  The four cross the street to a parked car, and Delmar pops open the trunk. Vargas is a block away.  He stops at a door, makes sure n one is watching him, then gives a secret knock.  The door opens and Vargas enters the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Next block.  Sixth door down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin watches the door close, then takes the flack jacke Delmar hands him.  All four men put on jackets.  Camoufla grease paint is passed around, and they paint their faces

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horman wants to know if we can go back and see the stripper afterwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Artie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delmar hands each of the men a HUGE military style M249 S machine gun.  Horman also takes a combat shotgun. Armed for a small war, they close the car trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready to rumble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horman sails the sombrero across the street.  They slap h with each other.  Rackin oozes wild charisma. His team wo follow him to hell and come back with the Devil on his or The four walk down the street like The Wild Bunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the doorway, Breen eases a fiber optic strand quietly under the door.  From this point on, the team uses milita hand signals to communicate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A distorted look at the foyer beyond the door.            Two GUARDS armed with Uzis smoke cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breen pulls out the strand and signals that there are two guards, armed, and points to where they are standing. The others nod. The door of the next building opens and a TEN YEAR OLD BO steps out...  Sees the armed men and is frightened. Breen puts a finger to his lips, smiles and gestures for Boy to go back inside.  The Boy returns to safety indoors Rackin gives final hand signal instructions to the team. Then they break open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door splinters inwards, and the two GUARDS quickly br up their Uzis.  Rackin shoots the one of the left before can get off a shot.  Breen takes out the one on the right seconds before he fires at Delmar. Rackin gestures for Delmar to guard the door, while Breen and Horman will use two-by-two cover formation to climb t stairs.  Rackin will check out the downstairs rooms. Rackin doesn't get far before gunfire erupts. A pair of massive MEXICANs in sweats, armed with Uzis, po from the top of the staircase and opens fire down at Bree and Horman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two of them!  On the stairs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breen and Horman back down the stairs and take cover as bullets turn steps into sawdust. Rackin turns to help them, when he hears a noise, spins a fires down the hallway... Blasting GUARD #3 off his feet before he gets all the way out the door.   Rackin gives it a beat to see if the Guar has any friends, but no one comes.  He goes to help... Breen covers Horman as he rolls from behind cover and fir thew shotgun up at the two Mexicans. MEXICAN #2 comes rolling down the stairs, dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got Manny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breen runs up the stairs, taking them two at a time, M249 SAW machinegun ready. Mexican #1 swings out and fires a burst, sending Breen ba a couple of steps. When Mexican #1 starts coming down the stairs, Breen send burst of gunfire to chase him up. For a moment, it's like an Errol Flynn/Basil Rathbone sta sword fight... but with machineguns.  Breen forcing the Mexican up a few steps, then the Mexican forcing him back Then Breen fakes right, moves left, and blasts Mexican #1 right off his feet.  When Breen gets to the top of the st he gestures for Rackin and Horman that it's clear.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE TOP OF THE STAIRS
dialogues.text: A hallway and two doors.  Rackin gestures for Horman to c while Breen uses the fiber optic strand. Breen pushes the strand under the first door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The distorted view of the room... Empty.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE TOP OF THE STAIRS
dialogues.text: Breen pulls out the strand and shakes his head. They creep to the next doorway, Breen sticks the strand i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A distorted view of a drug lab. RAY VARGAS, the sleazy American drug lawyer, has a briefc full of money.  Three DRUG DEALERS are opposite a table stacked with bags of black tar heroin.  A WOMAN hides in back of the room.  GUARD #4 stands near the door, gun rea to fire at the first one through.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE TOP OF THE STAIRS
dialogues.text: Breen pulls out the strand and relays the information. Rackin nods, and gestures instructions.  Horman will lay the floor with the shotgun aimed up.  Breen will take one side of the door and Rackin the other.  Nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vargas looks around nervously.  Guard #4 keeps his gun re THE DOOR SPLINTERS OPEN and Guard #4 fires... but there's one standing in the doorway.  A moment of confusion. By the time Guard #4 looks down, it's too late.  Horman B him right off his feet. Rackin and Breen swing into the room, guns ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands!  Everybody!  Hands!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get 'em up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone raises their hands.  DRUG DEALER #3 keeps his ha chest level... under his lapel is a gun in a shoulder rig Rackin yells down to Delmar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin gestures for the Woman to come out from her hiding place, then looks over the bags of heroin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, there's been a mistake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There has?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  I'm an American citizen.  I know you're just doing your job, but I don't belong here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buying heroin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, I asked at a bar where I could find some whores, and they must have misunderstood me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you put your hands against the wall.  You know the position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands against the wall!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone assumes the position.  Vargas still pleads with Rackin.  Trying not to get busted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on the same side.  I'm a lawyer. I have ID.... in my wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's when Drug Dealer #3 goes for his gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But finds an empty holster.  Rackin laughs, holds up the missing gun as if it's part of a magic trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for this?  Don't you know I'm magic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin does a few impressive gun tricks, then turns his h and the gun is GONE... disappeared.  Great close up magic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the magic man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horman pulls Vargas' wallet, opens it.  Money, credit car and a California Drivers License.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's American.  Ray Vargas.  From San Diego.  Visa,  American Express...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See?  This is a mistake.  You D.E.A. guys are doing a great job with the war on drugs, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not with the D.E.A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: F.B.I.?  D.E.A.?  We're all Americans. You can let me go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin smiles at Vargas, then nods to Breen. Breen opens fire, St. Valentine's Day Massacre style.  Al four men and the woman are shot to pieces. Horman pulls the money from Vargas' wallet, pockets it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) He thought we were with the FBI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others laugh as they gather up the briefcase full of money and the bags of black tar heroin, and vacate the ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the bottom of the stairs, Rackin nods at Delmar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd we get?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Few hundred thousand and a lot of heroin.  Not that Mexican brown shit, either... Black tar.  Mucho salable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four men leave the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ten Year Old Boy hides in a doorway as the four men w past.  While watching them, he notices a tattoo on Delmar arm.  The U.S. Marine Corps Symbol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The U.S. Marine Corps symbol on the gate of Camp Richards A beautiful spring day.  Marine Corps Band marching music the background. A title is supered with the camp name and location.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A line of MARINES marches past GENERAL ANTHONY NEWHOUSE.  Newhouse is a rugged, war hardened, leader.  More John Wa than Jack Webb, he weighs exactly what he weighed when he joined the Marines twenty five years ago. Next to General Newhouse is his aide, Lt. PETER VEILLERS. Veillers has spent too much time behind a desk filling ou paper work.  He looks too soft for combat. Each Marine salutes Newhouse as he passes. Gunnery Sergeant Martin L. RACKIN salutes as he passes, followed by Sgt. Breen, Corporal Horman, and Sgt. Delmar. When Delmar salutes, we see the tattoo on his arm again. The cold blooded killers who knocked off Vargas and the D Dealers are United States Marines!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: War.  A Marine Recon Team trapped behind enemy lines, as bullets spray around them.  Explosions illuminate the car Twisted metal.  Four dead Marines. Gunnery Sergeant RONALD L. MURPHY yells into a radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Base.  This is Force Recon Five.  We are under heavy fire, I repeat, heavy fire.  Request immediate extraction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another explosion shows Sgt. TED NEWHOUSE, early 20s and scared to death.  His name printed on his camouflage.  A bloody rag has stopped the bleeding from the bullet wound his leg.  Gripping Murphy's free hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me out of here, Murphy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Base.  This is Force Recon Five, do you copy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy, Recon Five.  Give me your Team Leader...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Team Leader is dead.  Primary Radio is dead.  Second Radio and Tail-end Charlie are dead.  This is the Point Man, Ron Murphy... Requesting immediate extraction.  Code word is Switchblades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the Assistant Team Leader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assistant Team Leader is wounded.  We need air extraction NOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unable to extract from your co-ords.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a wounded man....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chopper is waiting at extraction point alpha...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge explosion sends debris over Murphy and Ted.  When Murphy tries the radio again, he only gets static.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Base?  Base?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy lowers the mike, turns to Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't carry you.  You'll have to wait here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Murph... Don't leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hang on, Ted.  I'll come back with help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't leave me Murph... Please don't leave me here to die...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted reaches his hand out, as Murphy scrambles away.  Bull and explosions shattering the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy!  Murphy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy comes out of the nightmare... hears his name echoi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a chain around his neck: Three dog tags.  Two in perfe condition with his name.  The third, brown with corrosion (blood?), with the name EDWARD NEWHOUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Marine Corps main base. A title is supered with camp name and location.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General JOHN LATIMER is the top man in the Marine Corps.  Rugged and powerful, he earned his respect the old fashio way: He was a war hero. Latimer lets the JAILER lead him down the unfamiliar hall to a dark cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jailer nods, unlock the door... Waits for instruction

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jailer salutes, leaves.  Latimer enters the cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy looks up at Latimer, but doesn't salute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Gunnery Sergeant Ronald L. Murphy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.  Here to personally kick me out, General?  I'm honored.  I don't even think Riddick Bowe got this kind of service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You used to be the best Recon man there was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Used to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say you punched an officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being drunk isn't an excuse, it's another offense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what?  Your fifth?  Sixth offense?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever since Desert Storm you've been on the fast track to Court Martial.  One fight after another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear: That was the last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.  Your hearing is scheduled for tomorrow.  You'll probably do ten years in federal lock up before you're dishonorably discharged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy looks down at his unpolished shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're here to see me off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here to offer you a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two weeks ago, an American lawyer named Raymond Vargas and seven Mexican citizens were murdered in Tiajuna.  Shot more than a dozen times.  Execution style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The killers left behind bullets and brass.  Because one of the victims was an American, the Tiajuna Police worked overtime on the case, came up with some surprising results.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suicide?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The weapons were U.S. Marine Corps issue.  5.56mm SAW machine guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stolen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.  A ten year old who witnessed the murders said the killers were soldiers.  One of them had a Marine Corps tattoo on his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After last year's hazing scandals, we want to nip this one in the bud.  Camp Richards is just across the border from Tiajuna.  We're afraid that someone may be selling, stealing, or trading Marine issue ordnance to drug dealers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does this have to do with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recon is your specialty.  Sneaking behind enemy lines and returning with troop and target information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was in Storm... Years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want you to go undercover at Camp Richards.  Find out how these weapons are getting off the base.  The names of any personal involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newhouse still runs that base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Correct.  General Newhouse is in charge of Camp Richards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't run from the man forever, Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I killed his son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy's intensity is frightening... But Latimer responds only with a nod.  He locks eyes with Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no room in this Marine Corps for criminals and hooligans, Sgt. Murphy.  No room for men like you. (beat) But if you do your job right... find those responsible for these weapons

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ending up in the wrong hands... You will have transformed yourself from one of them, to one of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Marine Corps jeep rolls up to the checkpoint.  The DRIV shows his paperwork to the OFFICER at the gate. The Officer looks over the paperwork, hands it back to th Driver, looks at Murphy in the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have we here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corporal Ronald L. Murphy.  Transfer from Fort Lejuene, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy, cleaned up but minus some uniform stripes, hands Officer his paperwork. The Officer looks it over, nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Says here you used to be a Gunny.  Got busted down a few grades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Officer turns to the Driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show CORPORAL Murphy to his quarters. (to Murphy) Then the General wants to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy salutes, unhappy, and the jeep drives onto the bas The Officer at the Gate watches it drive away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. VEILLERS sits guard in the anteroom to General Newhou office.  The ultimate weaselly male secretary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corporal Murphy to see General Newhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Veillers inspects Murphy like a slab of meat.  An undercu of homosexuality from Veillers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy?  Hmmmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Veillers looks through the files on his desk, taking enou time to show Murphy who is in charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  I believe the General is expecting you. (to intercom) Corporal Murphy's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Veillers buzzes Murphy in to General Newhouse's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy salutes.  Newhouse has Murphy's file open on his d and every word he speaks is barbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corporal Ronald L. Murphy, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corporal.  Welcome to Camp Richards.  We hope you'll do better here than you did at Camp Lejuene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Murphy, I was against your transfer here.  But General Latimer explained his reasoning in detail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy wonders how much Newhouse was told of his mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think of his decision?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just here to follow orders, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent.  You seem to have had some difficulties with that in the past. (leafs through file) A discipline problem.  They thought I might be able to straighten you out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy realizes Newhouse knows nothing of his mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unlike General Latimer, I don't believe in second chances.  I can't forgive past mistakes. (leafs through file) And you've made a lot of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newhouse keeps the file open to the Recon incident where son was killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make even the smallest mistake here, and it will be my pleasure to Court Martial you and cart you off to a military prison for the rest of your shitty little life. (beat) Do you understand me, Murphy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dismissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy salutes and leaves.  Breaking the rules to investi the missing guns may land him in jail for ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin, Breen, Delmar, and Horman watch as Murphy leaves General's Office Building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kind of old for a Corporal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gate Officer said Newhouse put him on the top of the shit list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The watch Murphy cross the base to the barracks buildings

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corporal Horman.  Find out everything you can about our new man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horman heads to the General's Office, the others watch Mu enter his barracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one talks to Murphy as he opens his duffel bag and unp He has his bunk, his locker... his part of the world. No friends, no real home. The other MARINES keep their distance.  No one talks to h welcomes him, or acknowledges him. Murphy's first day on the base, he's already a pariah. When no one is looking, he takes a pack containing a mini camera, lock pick equipment, burglar tools and hides it u his matress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy waits at the counter for Sgt. TOM FULLER, the supp sergeant for the base. While Murphy waits, he notes the location of the computer and ledgers, where information on the stolen guns might b found.   One of the ledgers is on the counter. Fuller finishes and does his best Gomer Pile imitation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Supplies, Supplies.  What can I get for you, Corporal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bedding supplies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuller goes to grab the basic bedding kit: Blanket, sheet pillow, etc.  Murphy tries to sneak a peek into the ledge Looking for guns and ammo.  Almost gets caught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camp Lejuene.  How often do they do inventory around here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  Looking for a five finger discount?  Wonder how long before you'll be caught?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wondering if I order a new pair of boots how long it'll take you to get them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven working days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you order, what?  Once a week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Lotta questions for a transfer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just trying to learn my way around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What size?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boots.  You need new boots, right?  We may have them in stock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eleven and a half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuller shakes his head. Murphy grabs the sheets, starts o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Murphy turns, Fuller is examining the ledger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your name.  Rank.  Military ID number or Social Security number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Fuller's report?  Murphy hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the bed kit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy sets everything down, fills the information out in the ledger, and signs for the bed kit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MARINES get ready for hand to hand combat practice.  Murphy stands alone. Across the room, Horman whispers to Rackin, who eats an a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin and the team wander over to where Murphy loosens u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kind of old for a Corporal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to be a Gunny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd they bust you down for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fighting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You good at fighting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good at everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Think you could take on Sgt. Breen, here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy looks over Breen.  They're about the same size, sh be an even fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten bucks for every minute you stay off the mat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it twenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENERAL NEWHOUSE claps for attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your rifle may be your best friend, but you are not useless without it.  Hand to hand combat skills are your last line of defense, your only chance at survival in the field if a mission blows up in your face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy looks down, trying to forget his past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the moves, let's see what you can do in a practice session.  Remember, in the field, you'll be fighting for your life. (beat) Pair up on the mats, I'll blow the whistle to start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breen and Murphy pair up. But right before General Newhouse blows the whistle, the massive DELMAR taps Breen on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind if I cut in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breen steps aside, and Murphy gets a less than a second t size up his new opponent before the whistle blows. Rackin takes a bit of his apple, watching from the sideli Delmar gets the first strike, almost knocking Murphy off feet.   But waking him up. Murphy goes into action, using judo, akido, and street fighting skills to evade Delmar's next hits and get in a of his own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bigger they are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The harder they hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delmar SLAMS Murphy with a solid punch, sending him to th floor.  But Murphy hits the mats and twists, kicking Delm legs out from under him.  Delmar falls HARD. Murphy rolls over on him, pinning him to the mat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hit hard, but you don't hit smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin watches the fight closely from the side lines. Delmar headbutts Murphy and flips him off. The two fight on the ground, until Murphy flips back onto his feet and kicks at Delmar. Delmar is taking a beating.  It's obvious that Murphy is better fighter.  But Delmar has the weight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to play?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Murphy chops at Delmar, the brute plucks his hand fr the air and THROWS Murphy over his shoulder to the mat. Then pounces on him. Murphy rolls away, but Delmar grabs him and pulls him bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I play for keeps...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy can't get away.  Delmar puts his elbow to Murphy's throat and applies pressure.... strangling him. It has become a fight to the death!  Murphy scrambles, tr to get the brute's elbow off his throat.  He's turning bl Then the whistle blows, and Delmar lets up. Murphy gasps for breath while Delmar pops to his feet.  T Delmar reaches down and helps Murphy up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin gets Delmar's attention, gestures to bring Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handled yourself pretty well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said something about some money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin tosses his apple core, wipes his hand, offers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty Rackin.  That's Breen, Horman.  You've already met Delmar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who pays me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't take shit from anyone.  I like that. (beat) I'll get you a weekend pass on Friday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And my twenty five bucks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man's obsessed with money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin twists his hand and a twenty dollar bill magically appears in it.  He hands it to Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell of a trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a million of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin and his team leave Murphy in the Mat room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet on the base.   A few MARINES patrol the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A room full of sleeping Marines.  It's long past lights o Murphy seems to be asleep like the others.  His eyes open He carefully sneaks out of bed and pulls on his pants. While grabbing his boots, he makes a noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MARINE sleeping on the next bunk rolls over.  Waking Murphy stays still for a moment, then continues dressing. He pulls the pack of burglar equipment from under his bed and sneaks past the sleeping Marines to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy stays close to the walls as he sneaks across the b to the Supply Building. When he rounds the corner of a building, he almost runs i a two man PATROL making their rounds. Not enough time to retreat, Murphy ducks into a dark door The Patrol continues towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrolman #2 shines his flashlight on the door across fro Murphy.  He palms the knob.  Locked. Murphy sees the flashlight turning his way and hits the d Laying on the ground near the door. Patrolman #2's flashlight his the empty doorway.   Murphy has to hold his breath as Patrolman #2 stands only inches away and checks the door knob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All locked?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrolman #2 nods.  The Patrol rounds the corner. Murphy gets out of the dirt and continues sneaking across the base to the Supply Building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy uses the lock picks from his kit to get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy pushes the door closed and sneaks behind the count A pencil flash from the kit helps him find his way to the computer in the back of the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy turns off the flash and boots the computer. The room is suddenly bathed in blue light from the monito Murphy ducks.  Will the light attract the Patrolmen? Time passes.  It's safe.  Murphy begins typing commands i the computer.  Gets a menu of inventories.  Most recent..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) A week ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calls up the inventory. The screen shows BLANKETS, how many before, how many issu how many at inventory, how many Lost, Damaged, Destroyed. He scrolls down the list, finding the list of weapons... A light flashes through the window from outside!  A Patro Murphy hides behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two man Patrol shines their flashlight into the doorw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrolman #2 starts towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the window, Murphy can see Patrolman #2 coming... He has left the door unlocked! Murphy scrambles to the door, flicking the lock just as..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrolman #2 tries the door.  Locked.  He moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they've gone, Murphy sneaks back to the computer. M249 SAW Machineguns..... The number at the beginning and end of the inventory are the same.  None are lost or dama

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unaccounted for: 0 Murphy checks ALL of the guns.... All are accounted for. LIVE AMMO shows many rounds issued for training exercises Fuller has signed for most of them personally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy sneaks out of the building, picks the door locked. When he starts sneaking back to the barracks, he hears a noise.  Talking.  A flashlight.  The Patrol has returned! Murphy hides in the shadows on the far side of the buildi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe Fuller left the damned computer on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrolman #1 flashes his light inside the Supply Building The computer is off, the Supply Building completely dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must be losing my mind.  Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Patrol leaves the area. Murphy comes out of the shadows, then notices a small sup shack with dozens of locks and chains protecting it. His pen light illuminates the 'address': BUILDING 48-H. Murphy shuts off his flash and sneaks back to the barrack

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy puts his burglar kit back under the matress, takes off his boots and pants, and climbs into bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reveille sounds.  Marines go through their morning routin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy makes sure no one is looking, dials a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Latimer, this isn't a secure phone.  I'm going to make it fast.  There was an inventory last week.  No weapons missing, but they may have cooked the books. (beat) Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy hangs up and falls in for breakfast. From across the Parade Grounds Sgt. Breen watches Murphy. Wondering what the phone call was about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy, Rackin and the rest of the Marines on base are dr in full camouflage, helmets, packs, and rifles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today we'll be running the "Quigley" Course.  This is a hard-ass course.  Has nothing to do with that dopey Tom Sellack movie.  This course is for real Marines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breen continues to study Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will start in this muddy ditch. You will crawl down the ditch, your point man checking ahead of him for poisonous snakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poisonous snakes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, Corporal Horman. (beat) At the end of the ditch you will run five miles through the woods, climb a forty percent grade, then slide down the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy has been through all of this before... and worse i Desert Storm.  He and Rackin seem relaxed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you will crawl along a length of razor wire while Lieutenant Veillers fires a 50 caliber machinegun over

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: your heads.  Because today is Friday, we will be firing blanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horman looks slightly relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you hear the pistol, start moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newhouse raises his gun and fires. Murphy, Rackin, and the Marines hit the dirt, crawling th the muddy ditch, holding their guns up out of the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go! Go! Go! Go! Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The muddy Marines run through the woods, rifles ready for action.  They climb the grade, and slide down the other s Horman gets in trouble, and Breen has to help him out. Murphy and Rackin run with ease.  Next to each other.  Al like a team.  Both men are naturals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the razor wire, a dozen Marines hit the dirt and crawl along the path as Sgt. Fuller fires a machinegun overhead

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!  Go!  Go!  Go!  Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin lets Murphy crawl ahead alone.  Murphy crawls alon the wire, keeping his head down.  The machinegun firing.. Send dirt spraying all around Murphy. They are using live rounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullets flying right overhead, like that night in Iraq. FLASH CUT:  Murphy in Iraq.  Bullets and explosions.  Han on to Ted's hand. Murphy snaps out of it and uses all of his combat trainin to stay low and avoid the machinegun fire.  He crawls to safety, moves to his feet, and spits dirt from his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin gives Sgt. Fuller a glance as he crawls through th fire zone.  No bullets come anywhere near him. Rackin comes to his feet next to Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's using live ammo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could have been killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin shrugs, makes a gate pass appear in his hand: magi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you could probably use a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands the pass to Murphy, who smiles at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McBain's is a Marine hangout, the way McP's in Coranado i Navy SEAL Team hangout.  Flashing neon and loud music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheap pitchers of beer, and lots of attractive women. Murphy comes in with Rackin and his team.  Everyone in th joint greets Rackin as if he's their king.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty!  It's the magic man!  Marty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin high fives some of the Marines on his way to be ba Delmar lags behind to talk to some of them.  Whispered conversations.  Money changes hands.  Gambling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite a fan club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They love the magic man.  I make all their problems disappear... With a pitcher of beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin makes a $5 bill appear and pays for the pitcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long you been in the Corps?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since Storm.  I re-upped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeeze, you don't want to go home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't wait to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin watches while the others talk with Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spend the rest of my life working at a refinery?  Taking as much OT as I can so I can pay for my own place, don't have to deal with my stepdad? (beat) I couldn't wait to enlist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy looks at Rackin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same story, different town.  I gave up a promising future digging ditches for farm irrigation to join the Corps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody laughs.  Delmar gestures for another pitcher.  Horman is studying some girls across the room.  Breen is talking with the most beautiful woman in the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought Breen had a wife squirreled away in off base housing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breen'll get home to her... eventually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heard the General wanted to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What big ears you got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the magic man.  All seeing, all knowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the pitcher comes, Rackin makes another $5 appear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How tight is Newhouse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of us joined the Marines for the pay.  At Lejuene I picked up some spare change buying supplies with the base discount and reselling them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That why you're here?  Got caught?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sent me here for fighting. I'm a "trouble maker".  How tight are they with the supplies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuller's a fucking bean counter.  You couldn't get an extra blanket out of him if we had a new ice age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Del's right.  No way that scam would work here.  When we field test our rifles, they count the bullets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like you lost a couple stripes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lose them fighting or stealing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy unconsciously touches his dog tags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was with Force Recon in Storm. They sent us in to Bagdad to scout targets.  The mission went to hell.  Five men died... I was the only one who walked away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They usually give you medals for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the casualties was Newhouse's son.  I'm the reason he's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeeze, Newhouse must love having you here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One fuckup and I'm in Leavenworth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin laughs, spots the beautiful woman talking with Bre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Sweet Lucille!  Want you to meet a guy...  This here's Ron Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUCY WILDER is a sexy townie, dressed to kill.            She squeezes between Rackin and Murphy, offers her hand.  Murphy smiles and gives it a shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're new.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breen is less than happy.  He was making time with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy, here, is the best looking gal in all of San D.  Best dancer, too. Why don't you show him a few steps?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not very...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She yanks Murphy onto the dance floor, and they start dan Rackin turns to Breen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They make a nice couple, don't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breen says nothing. As Rackin and Delmar watch them dance, Breen and Horman h to the restroom. MURPHY AND LUCY dance, having a good time. Rackin and Delmar watch them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin nods in agreement. MURPHY AND LUCY DANCE.  When the band plays a slow number they awkwardly move closer together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long you been at Richards?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couple of weeks.  Transferred from North Carolina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a girl back home?  Wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foot loose and fiance free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy laughs and pulls him closer.  They continue dancing close, even after the music changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Typical townie tale.  Moved to California to get away from my parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a job and an apartment.  Still looking for a man who isn't completely full of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You took an oath to serve, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean by that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gave your word, and you're keeping it.  Do you know how rare that is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I screw up, I get court martialed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most people who screw up just walk away.  No responsibility.  No regrets.  Like their word meant nothing to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their faces are close, and Lucy kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you won't lie to me?  Lead me on with your sweet talk then dump me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss again, with more passion.  Then Lucy presses aw She looks into Murphy's eyes, wondering if she can trust him, wondering if she should take him to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look... I normally don't....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind...                      Let's just go back to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy nods.  They reluctantly release each other.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BAR
dialogues.text: Murphy flags down the BARTENDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get this lady whatever she wants. (to Lucy) I'll be back in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy crosses to the rest rooms, glancing back at Lucy b he enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie Horman lays on the floor in a puddle of his own vom twitching with convulsions. It takes Murphy a moment to realize that Rackin and Breen are taking care of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin snaps in anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here!  Just go away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy nods and backs out of the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy sits down next to Lucy.  She sees his expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy finishes his beer, trying to wipe the image from h mind... Horman looking like Ted Newhouse. AFTER A MOMENT, Rackin takes a seat next to Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's fine.  Look, I'm sorry for snapping like that.  Artie has a medical problem.  If he doesn't take the medication, that's what happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin lowers his voice, forcing Murphy to move closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's afraid if anyone finds out, he'll get bounced out of the Corps with a medical discharge. (beat) Can we keep this between ourselves?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Sure.  Should we take him to a hospital?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He took his medicine.  He's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breen and Delmar help Horman across the room and into a c He's been cleaned up, but still looks awful.  Eyes slight glazed and a dopey expression on his face.  (High as a ki Lucy regains Murphy's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to go to the beach tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got to be back on base by midnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we have here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin makes a weekend pass appear in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A weekend pass!  Good until six AM Monday.  Here: Have a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin hands the pass to Murphy, smiles at Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have any money for a motel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy just grabs him by the lapels, leading him out of the bar.   Breen looks at Rackin, VERY unhappy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was my pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin gives him a devilish smile, makes the car keys app in his hand, gives them to Breen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.  We gotta get Horman back to the base before he has another big smack attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cheap family apartment building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy pulls Murphy to bed.  After they kiss, she studies h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can stay the night, on two conditions...  Don't ever lie to me. And don't just leave me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy nods, and she pulls on top of her. They make love in the moonlight from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonlight through the windows, as Breen and Delmar search Murphy's bunk and trunk.  Rackin watches.  Horman, still looking awful, sits on a bunk. They tear the place apart, sifting through everything Mur owns... At one point Breen almost looks under the matress but Horman moans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeeze, man.  I need another pop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breen checks on Horman, and misses looking under the matress... Misses Murphy's burglar kit and secret camera. They finish, and cart Horman out of the barracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: War.  Murphy pulls his hand away from Ted Newhouse's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hang on, Ted.  I'll come back with help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't leave me Murph... Please don't leave me here to die...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted reaches his hand out, as Murphy scrambles away.  Bull and explosions shattering the night.  Illuminating the do tags around Ted's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy!  Murphy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy keeps running.  Explosions flashing around him. He hits the dirt as bullets tear up the earth in front of him.  Almost hitting him.  Dirt spraying. Murphy can barely hear Ted's voice...   But in those brie moments of silence between explosions, it echoes in the d When the gunfire passes, he starts running.  Through the darkness and explosions to the extraction point. An AH-1W Cobra Helicopter touches down in front of Murphy A MARINE inside the chopper gestures for him to jump onbo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy!  Murphy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy takes a final look back at where Ted lays dying... And jumps into the Helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy bolts out of the nightmare holding the dog tags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy?  It's almost six.  You'd better get going if you want to make it back for reveille.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy looks at the tags, shakes the nightmare away and g out of bed.  He gives Lucy a kiss, then dresses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy checks his watch, dials General Latimer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Latimer picks up the phone.  His private line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy, here.  I may have a lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Missing weapons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something else.  One of the men got sick in a bar a couple of night ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's unusual?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way the other men acted was unusual.  I got the feeling this guy was having a drug overdose...  Maybe a hot load of heroin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mexicans who were murdered with Vargas were heroin exporters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to follow this kid, see where it leads me.  Maybe he traded guns for smack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep me posted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy hangs up the pay phone, takes another look at his watch, and runs to the front gate of the base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy shows his pass to the gate OFFICER as he jogs past

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy doesn't even slow down, he jogs to his barracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy watches Horman as they break into pairs and practi hand to hand combat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pair up on the mats, I'll blow the whistle to start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MARINE Murphy was partnered with gets a tap on the shoulder and is replaced by BREEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Murphy.  How was your weekend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Murphy can answer, the whistle blows and Breen is over him.  Slamming. Hitting. Kicking.  Trying to kill hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, Breen.  Take it down a notch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breen becomes more savage.  Murphy really has to fight. flips Breen onto his back and pins him to the mat. When the whistle blows, Breen storms away. Murphy is conf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy jogs behind Horman, keeping an eye on him.  All of the men run lap around the parade grounds.  Breen is a fe men behind Murphy... Not looking happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy sneaks around a corner and opens a dumpster.  We c hear the others exercising nearby.  Close.   Murphy pulls out bags of trash, opening them, examining the contents. One bag contains a stained manila envelope.  Murphy looks inside: Needles.  Matchbooks burned down.  Drug evidence. He closes the envelope and replaces it in the trash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy watches Horman, Breen, Delmar and Rackin all leave the bathroom together.  He's suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They piss together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The middle of the night.  Only Sentries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy wakes when he hears a noise.  Whispering.  He roll over, looking for the source. Breen has awakened Horman, and is waiting while he dresse Murphy feigns sleep, watching as the two leave.  He rolls out of bed and looks out the barracks window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breen and Horman jump into a pair of waiting Humvees driv by Delmar and Rackin.  The two trucks pull out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy throws on his clothes and runs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two Humvees pass through the gates, waved through by Gate Officer.  Then the gates close. Murphy runs up to the Gates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a pass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm supposed to be with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not.  They're gone, you're here.  They had a pass, you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where they going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to the lock up, if you don't get back to barracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy sees no way to follow the Humvees, tail lights disappearing in the distance, so he goes back to bed. The Gate Officer makes a note in his log about Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. IRON MAN COURSE
dialogues.text: Murphy watches Rackin and Horman with the other Marines, listening to Newhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ironman Course is the most difficult exercise on the base.  You will be alloted two magazines, a total of thirty five rounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newhouse gestures to the course: a small field filled wit hillocks, a few small stone walls, and other obstacles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are thirty five pop up targets which are triggered by motion sensors planted in the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newhouse takes a step back and BING! a target pops up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be warned: Only twenty nine of these targets are hostiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The target is a mother holding a child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A score of twenty five is passing.  If you hit sixteen or fewer of the hostile targets you will be sent back to phase one training.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy watches as Delmar joins them and whispers to Racki

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Murphy.  You'll go first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy is issued two clips from Sgt. Fuller, slaps one in his rifle, enters the course when Newhouse starts the clo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy dives into the course, spinning and firing as the targets pops up.  He almost shoots a NUN, but manages to all of the hostile targets and none of the friendlies.  H exits the course in record time... Murphy is damned good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty nine out of twenty nine, good time, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy watches the others move through the course. Until one of the Marines gets halfway through and yells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help!  Someone help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone runs onto the course, triggering the rest of the targets.  They find the MARINE on the ground, cradling BR Breen is dead.  Shot a dozen times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a medic!  Somebody get a medic!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy and the others look down in horror at Breen.  But Rackin, Delmar, and Horman don't seem properly concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MARINES stand at attention in their dress uniforms as General Newhouse addresses them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant Breen was dead on arrival at Veteran's Hospital. (beat) I ordered Lt. Veillers to perform a full investigation into this incident. (beat) Lieutenant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant Breen's death was the result of a training accident.  At some point within the Ironman exercise he wandered onto the course and was shot by friendly fire.  Probably by more than one participant. (beat) No one is to blame for this incident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy looks at Rackin.  Then he looks at Sgt. Fuller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant Breen's widow has been hard hit by this.  I think we should all remember her in our prayers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Veillers and Fuller have a whispered exchange. Murphy sees them together: The man who fired live ammo at him, and the man who is covering up Breen's murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Veillers shows Murphy in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corporal Murphy, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Veillers tries to stick around but Murphy stares at him u he backs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm busy, Corporal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was no training accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Veillers has done a thorough investigation... Are you disputing the decision of a superior officer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.  Breen didn't even run the course that day.  I hadn't even seen him since the previous evening...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Covered in Veiller's report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newhouse lifts the sealed report, looks at Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corporal, this entire conversation borders on insubordination.  How badly do you want to do jail time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just going to let that man die and do nothing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newhouse doesn't answer... Murphy let his son die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The report has already been filed with MARCENT.  It's been classified as a training accident. (beat) Do you really want to open up the past?  Break the seals on old reports? (threatening) Because I don't recommend it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy salutes and leaves the general's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Veillers watches Murphy pass through his office on th way out... Then picks up the phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy walks across the base, lost in thought. Then he spots Horman looking around before ducking in to Latrine.  He decides to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darkness.  Murphy tries to switch on the light, doesn't w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM!  He's thrown against the wall by an assailant.  Whe the assailant tries to pin him there, Murphy goes into ac Murphy twists, tossing the assailant across the dark bath

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the assailant seems to attack immediately.  Slamming Murphy against the wall again.  Murphy is fighting three guys, not one.  He ducks a punch, kicks the legs out from one of them, and fights the other two. Murphy fights like hell, but there's no way to win agains three opponents.  He ends up pinned against the wall.  A knife jambed against his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see what we've got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights flicker on.  Rackin calmly eats an apple.  Hor at the breaker panel.  Delmar holds Murphy against the wa the knife at his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, guys, it's Corporal Murphy. (to Murphy) So, what brings you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanted to talk to Horman...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way you talked to General Newhouse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin smiles at Murphy's reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the magic man.  All seeing, all knowing.  I can make you disappear. (beat) But wouldn't you rather tell me about your little chat with the General?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought Breen got a raw deal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breen got the deal of a lifetime. Right guys?  He'll be buried a hero, and in a couple of months his wife can sue the Corps... (smiles) You want to be buried a hero?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you threatening me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you believe in magic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only in a young girl's heart... and I'm not even sure about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you really want to talk to Artie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delmar presses the knife blade against his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys are running some sort of scam.  I don't know what.  I'm just looking to cut myself in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Murphy, I read your file.  I have a friend in the General's Office.  You're a real disgrace to the uniform, aren't you?  Interesting stuff.  A good read.  I give it four stars.  What do you say, Artie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three stars.  But I liked the part where he killed the General's son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to know how it ends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The knife draws a little blood on Murphy's throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we cut him in?  Or cut him out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, he's going to end up in jail one way or the other.  We might as well help him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delmar pulls the blade away from Murphy's throat.  Faces inches apart, Delmar studies Murphy's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we trust him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what we're about to find out. Corporal Horman, requisition a helicopter for tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horman salutes and leaves.  Delmar continues to hold him against the wall, knife ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A helicopter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a little test of trust.  Nothing to worry about.  You'll either pass... or fail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AH-1W Cobra Attack Helicopter scatters leafs as it wa for Horman, Rackin, and Murphy to climb aboard.           Delmar is in the cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When all are onboard, Delmar lifts the Cobra into the air flying high over the city to a stretch of nearby desert. No lights below... only barren darkness. Rackin opens the side door of the helicopter.  Wind rushe in.  He stands, looking out at the ground far below.  Rac is the charismatic descendent of the Tent Preacher.  When speaks, you BELIEVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're the fucking Marines, Murphy.  We're the best there is.  Are you ready to travel to the next level? Are you ready to become one of the true elite?  Only the strong survive.  Are you strong enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A simple test of trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin grabs Murphy's wrist tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take my hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment of hesitation, then Murphy grabs Rackin's wrist a fireman's grip.  Holding on to each other's wrists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust in me to hold you.  Trust in yourself not to let go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin backs Murphy to the open helicopter door.  Horman Delmar watch, as if it's a baptism... Maybe it is. Murphy knows it's coming.  Delmar tilts the chopper, Murp falls out the open door.  Hanging on to Rackin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy dangles out the helicopter door, holding onto Rack for dear life.  They hold tight to each other, as Murphy tries not to look at the ground a few hundred feet below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what trust is all about.  It comes from the heart.  You have to believe in me.  Believe I won't drop you.  Believe I know what's best for you.  Trust in me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy holds on as the Helicopter continues moving.  The ground, FAR below.  They hang on to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I let go of you, you're dead.  You have to believe in the magic man.  Do you believe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I BELIEVE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful night for just hanging out, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy holds on, feeling his grip loosening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just going to leave me hanging like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Afraid I'll drop you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cold out here.  Didn't know we were going to be playing outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin laughs and hauls Murphy up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy climbs into the helicopter, Rackin closes the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter turns around and zooms back to San Diego.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy sits with Rackin and Horman in the back of the helicopter while Delmar chauffers them back to the base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me tell you about my band of Merry Men.  It all started with graffiti.  These gang kids were spray painting their names all over the neighborhood.  Then the drug dealers moved in. (beat) Pissed me off.  I thought: Somebody should do something about that. (beat) Then I realized I was a fucking United States Marine. I had the power, a God given right, to stop these scumbags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin is so charismatic, Murphy doesn't even notice him taking out a heroin kit and preparing to shoot up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I organized a little Midnight Raid.  I have a guy in Newhouse's Office who helps me requisition equipment.  Guns, humvees, whatever I need.  Same guy that got you that weekend pass. (beat) We started cleaning up the streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knocking off drug dealers.  Taking the money and the drugs.  Who was going to stop us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy nods.  Horman ties off, heats and mixes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how much money those scumbags make?  Millions.  And the junkies just keep on coming. (beat) At first we threw the drugs away.  Then we realized how much they were worth.  How much the junkies needed their fix.  We started dealing... (looks at Horman) And using.  Now we've taken over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy notices Horman shooting up, getting that first big rush of calm.  Smiling blissfully as he unties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeeze, my headache's gone.  Thanks to aspirin free smack....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin laughs, pulls out his own kit, prepares to shoot u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you were one of us, Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy smiles.  Is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the moment I read your file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin shoots up, feels the rush, smiles at Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and I are so much alike.  Hell, we could be brothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  We even have the same initials.  Notice that? (beat) Marty L. Rackin and Ron L. Murphy.  What does your L stand for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leroy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin just laughs.  Murphy is surrounded by Junkies.  Is this where he belongs?  Is he really one of them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter lands back at base, and everyone files out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin claps a hand to Murphy's shoulder and makes a week pass appear in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weekend Pass.  Get out of here and enjoy yourself, okay?  You earned it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.  We're all in this together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy takes the pass from Rackin, getting in deeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy dials General Latimer's private line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Latimer here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, it's not just stolen weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an organized gang on the base.  Running drugs, killing anybody who gets in their way.  One of the guys, Rick Breen, got killed on some midnight raid against a rival drug ring and they covered it all up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy had a wife, General.  Some poor woman who thinks her husband died in a training accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who runs this gang?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy named Marty Rackin.  A real bad ass.  Calls himself the magic man.  He runs it like a cult...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get next to him, join if you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy notices Horman in the park.  Walking towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find out everything you can, and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horman spots Murphy and comes right up to the phone booth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up quickly, smiles at Horman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who you talking to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girl I'm seeing, Lucy.  Just making sure her husband isn't home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horman laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna be down at McBrides if you two want to stop by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we'll do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, man, glad to have you on board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy nods, and they go their separate ways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horman waits until Murphy is a block away before followin Keeping a block between them, Horman follows Murphy acros to Lucy's Apartment Building. Horman watches as Murphy rings the bell.  When Lucy opens the door and they embrace, Horman turns and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy rolls off of Murphy, and they lay in bed together. fingers stroke his chest, almost touching the dog tags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you have three?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's personal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keeping secrets already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
