dialogues.text: (beat) I was the only survivor from a Marine Recon Team in Desert Storm. The third tag is from a guy who got left behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't his family get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Someday I'll give it to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be tough to be stuck on base all week.  You have any friends on base, guys you hang out with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pretty much a loner. The new guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Marty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just went out for beers once.  We're not going steady or anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought he was everybody's friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got nothing against the guy.  What's with all the questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like to know who I let inside me. You don't tell me much on your own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Ask me anything, I won't lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd they send you out to San Diego?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drinking and fighting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't drink much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See?  It worked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy laughs, and rolls back on top of him.  They make lov in the moonlight.  Murphy feeling like a lying rat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy on the bed holding a framed photo.  We can't see the picture.  Murphy comes from the bathroom, looks at his wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to get back to the base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you next week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the apartment door closes behind Murphy, Lucy moves the phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's good.  I tried to get him to talk, but he wouldn't say a thing.  He acts like a boy scout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we can trust him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy hangs up the phone, looks at the photo in her hands. A wedding picture.                                       Lucy and Breen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin hangs up and turns to Delmar and Horman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't say a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Wednesday's a go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see how he works out under fire. Horman, requisition us some guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start across the park to the base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camp is asleep except for the guards on patrol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy is having a nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An AH-1W Cobra Helicopter touches down in front of Murphy A MARINE inside the chopper gestures for him to jump onbo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy!  Murphy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy takes a final look back at where Ted lays dying... And jumps into the Helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy grabs the OFFICER, yells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't leave!  I've got a wounded man back there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orders are to pull out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't just leave him to die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The General's orders are clear: Pick up survivors and get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy pulls his gun, aims it at the Officer's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck the General.  We going back to pick him up or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not risking my men or my craft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do it myself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Officer turns to the pilot and gestures to lift off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Helicopter begins to lift and fly away.  Ted Newhouse screams in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy!  Murphy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horman wakes Murphy up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy dresses quickly and follows Horman out of the barr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy sits in the Humvee with Delmar behind the Humvee w Horman and Rackin.  Rackin shows his pass to the Officer. The two Humvees pass through the gates, waved through by Gate Officer.  Then the gates close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bad part of town near the freeway onramps.  Both Humv parked under an overhead light.  The Team gathers around hood of one of the vehicles, where plans are made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These Mexicans have been trying to form a beachhead in our territory for the past few months.  It's time to teach them the power of the United States Marines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin pulls out a series of satellite photos of a ranch style house, spreads them on the hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you can see from our spy in the sky satellite photos...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get those?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Classified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delmar laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We requisition the photos and the CIA takes them for us.  They haven't got a clue what we're using them for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeeze, can we get to the fun part?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three entrances.  Front door, back door, and garage.  If we park one of the hummers in front of the garage, we can seal that exit. (to Murphy) Murphy, you and Delmar will enter through the back.  Looks like sliding glass doors, so be careful. (to Horman) Artie and I will take the front doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We talking cocaine, here, or smack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a meth lab, so be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muy Peligroso.  Could blow up in our face if we aren't careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guns and grease paint are handed out, and the men get rea for battle.  Murphy checks the action on his SAW machineg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No escapes.  If one of them gets away, they can call for back up.  Don't want to have to fight our way back to the base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many you think are in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more than a dozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When everyone is in their camouflage, Rackin checks the a on his gun and smiles at the team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready to rumble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wild bunch climb into their Humvees and zip away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet.  A two storey ranch style house off the main road. Suddenly one of the Humvees pulls into the driveway, bloc the door.  Horman and Rackin roll out, guns ready. They CRASH open the front door and enter in standard two two cover formation.  Like a drug bust.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BACK DOORS
dialogues.text: Murphy and Delmar hear the front door break open and blas through the sliding glass doors, entering the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delmar signals Rackin and Horman in the front room, looks through the cafe doors at the kitchen.  To his right is a archway leading to the downstairs bedrooms.  All is quiet Delmar moves towards the archway, SAW machinegun ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY a huge GANG BANGER with an army issue 45 automat slams through the cafe doors and begins firing at him. Delmar spins, levels the machinegun, and blasts the Gang Banger, hitting him in the center of the chest and throwi him back through the cafe doors and into the kitchen sink The cafe doors swing back and forth from the momentum. A moment of silence, then all hell breaks lose.  A giant "Wild Bunch" style shoot out. GANG BANGER #2 springs from the hallway, aiming a shotgun Murphy.  Murphy blasts him off his feet.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: A pair of GANG BANGERS pops up at the top of the stairs, firing down on Horman and Rackin. Rackin blasts one with his machinegun, Horman blasts the other with his combat shotgun. One of the pair falls over the stairway bannister, smashi a table on his way to the floor. Rackin and Horman cover each other as they climb the stai Stopping at the top steps to recon the upstairs hallway.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DOWNSTAIRS HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Three bedroom doors to Delmar's left.  Holding tightly to the M249 SAW, he moves up to the first one and kicks it o

dialogues.speaker: IN THE FIRST BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Delmar drops low, machinegun ready.  His eyes scan the interior of the bedroom.  The room is empty. Delmar backs slowly out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Delmar hears a noise behind him and spins, ready to fire. Murphy stands behind him, holding his machinegun ready. gestures down the hallway, and they creep forward in two two cover formation.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE UPSTAIRS HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Horman edges down to a bedroom door, shotgun ready. Rackin covers as he takes a deep breath and kicks down th door, springing inside with the shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: GANG BANGER 5 is ready with a 44 Magnum in each hand. He opens fire the minute he sees Horman. Horman fires the shotgun once at Gang Banger 5, missing h and smashing a full length mirror on the wall to pieces. Horman rolls into the hallway, away from the gunfire. Rackin swings in, spray Gang Banger #5 with machinegun fi

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DOWNSTAIRS HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Delmar pulls out of the line of fire as GANG BANGER #6 ro out of a doorway, blasting with a pair of 45 automatics. GANG BANGER 7 spins out of the first bedroom holding a do barrel shotgun.  He aims directly at Delmar, ready to fir Murphy spins around and fires.  Hits Gang Banger 7 in the shoulder, spinning him to the left in a graceful pirouett which ends with the shotgun discharging into the ceiling. Delmar blasts Gang Banger #6 after an exchange of gunfire

dialogues.speaker: IN THE UPSTAIRS HALLWAY
dialogues.text: GANG BANGER #8 rolls out of the second bedroom and fires machinegun at Rackin. Plaster explodes from the wall next to his head, showerin him with powder, adding to the light diffusion in the hal Rackin spins around and fires at Gang Banger 8, hitting h square in the chest.  She flies back and skids along the uncarpeted floor towards the end of the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DOWNSTAIRS HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Delmar covers Murphy as he kicks open a bedroom door and rolls inside, gun ready.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: A noise behind Murphy!  He spins, aiming his M249 machine At a crying BABY in a crib. Murphy realizes where he is and what he is doing and lowe his machinegun.  He is killing civilians. GANG BANGER #9, a sexy Latino woman, crashes out of the closet, shotgun aimed at Murphy's head.  BLAAAAAM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy, gun down, had no way to defend himself.  No way t return fire.  He let his guard down, and pays the price. GANG BANGER #9's blood sprays all over him, as she is tak out by Delmar's machinegun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could have been killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delmar nods, kills the baby.  Murphy tries not to vomit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delmar sweeps through the rest of the room: All clear.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DOWNSTAIRS HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Delmar exits the bedroom, yells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Downstairs!  All clear!

dialogues.speaker: IN THE UPSTAIRS HALLWAY
dialogues.text: From the end of the hall, TRIVAS (Lead Gang Banger), roll into the hallway, springs to his feet, and fires his Uzi Horman and Rackin. Bullets whiz past the pair as Horman reaims the shotgun a squeezes the trigger. The shot misses, knocking a hole in the wall.  A few pell hit Trivas in the shoulder, dots of red on his white shir Trivas lowers his Uzi, rolls into the last bedroom to esc Horman and Rackin bolt down the hallway after him.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE LAST BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Horman and Rackin find the meth lab... Plus Trivas and a pair of GANG BANGERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throw the guns down, and you can live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know who you're messing with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they find out what you've done, there's gonna be a war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) How many tanks do you gang bangers have?  How many helicopters?  How many rocket launchers? (beat) Your days are done, and mine have just begun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's almost a fast draw contest, but Trivas is too slow. Rackin and Horman BLAST Trivas and the two Gang Bangers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upstairs is clear!

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: Murphy and Delmar hear Horman's yell... Then a FEMALE GAN BANGER rolls out of a closet, fires a couple of shots at Murphy and Delmar, and takes off out the back doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy rolls to his feet and takes off after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Female Gang Banger runs out the back doors, spins whe she hears Murphy following and fires. Murphy hits the dirt.  When he comes up, the Female Gang Banger has hopped onto a motorcycle, and is tearing away. Murphy chases her to the street.  She's getting away. Murphy raises his M249 SAW.... but hesitates.  Can he sho her in the back as she's running?  No. Delmar scrambles out the front door, sees her escaping on the motorcycle.  Murphy not firing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's getting away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy doesn't fire.  Delmar raises his machinegun, reali she's out of range.  Way down the street.  He pumps the M 40mm grenade launcher attached to the underside of the SA Fires.

dialogues.speaker: BLAAAAM
dialogues.text: The grenade shoots down the street after the speeding motorcycle, landing close by and EXPLODING into a BALL OF FLAME which takes out the cycle and Female Gang Banger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was out of range.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't even try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delmar turns and goes back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last of the drugs and money are loaded into the two Humvees, and they get ready to roll. Murphy starts to climb in with Delmar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're riding with Horman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy climbs into the Humvee Horman is driving. Rackin climbs into Delmar's Humvee.  Both vehicles roar o of there, passing the burning mess of motorcycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy looks at the burning motorcycle, then back down at his hands.  Are these the hands of a killer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delmar and Rackin talk about Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just froze up.  Couldn't fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His first time out, he's bound to make a few mistakes.  Remember Artie's first time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's more than that.  I know you two have become pals, now... But what if Murphy isn't who he claims?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he's a snitch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw his record.  You know the way Newhouse is dogging him.  The guy's one of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should kill him.  Why take chances?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Del, we've got ourselves a war brewing, here.  We need every man we can get. (beat) Murphy's a good man.  I'm willing to excuse his opening night jitters.  Give the man a break. (beat) Too soon for another training accident, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the boss, boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delmar will give Murphy a break.  This time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gate Officer opens the gates and waves the two Humvee through.  He closes the gates behind them. The two Humvees cross the base and pull up in front of on of the supply shacks... Building #48-H.  The one with tons of extra padlocks and security measures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin unlocks the building with a set of keys worn on th same neck chain as his dog tags.  He opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy can't believe what's inside: Not just a stash of d but TONS on drugs, plus STACKS of money sealed in plastic Rackin isn't some small time drug dealer, he's a DRUG LOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unload the Hummers and get these guns back to the supply room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delmar, Horman, and Murphy unload.  Rackin shoots up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take care of the guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin nods... and enters the land of nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the Humvees are empty, Delmar tosses Murphy keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take one, I'll take the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy and Delmar climb into the Humvees and drive them b to the motor pool building.  Rackin relocks the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy takes off his clothes quietly and climbs into his bunk.  Around him, a dozen men sleep.  Murphy hears the b crying every time he starts to nod off.  Can't sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reveille sounds.  Marines go through their morning routin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy waits until Fuller is alone before entering.  He m a bee line to the ledger, pulling it away from Fuller and flipping pages.  Fuller tries to wrestle it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Wait a minute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who signed out for the two Humvees and the weaponry last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Humvees left the base last night. The milage has to be recorded, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No vehicles left the base last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was riding in one of them.  Had a M249 Squad Automatic in my hands.  Spare clips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuller yanks the ledger out of his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about, Corporal, but it sounds like a Court Martial offence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.  You going to tell me, or General Newhouse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have nothing to tell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you in the General's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy starts to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy.  Don't open this can of worms.  It'll all blow up in your face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy continues out.  Fuller looks desperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  But not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy stops, turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someplace private.  The Ironman Range.  Four am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you aren't there, I'll make sure you're next in line for Leavenworth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy leaves.  Fuller looks very nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marines sleep... Except for Murphy, who quietly rolls out bed and dresses in the darkness. Murphy checks the action on his Beretta M9/92F combat pis grabs an extra magazine.  Ready for action in the event t is a trap. Murphy looks at Horman's bunk: occupied.  Blanket pulled Then he quietly sneaks out of the barracks to meet Fuller

dialogues.speaker: EXT. IRON MAN COURSE
dialogues.text: Shadows and more shadows. Murphy creeps onto the course, hand on his holstered gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuller?  Fuller?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Searching for Fuller, wondering if he's been set up. He hears a noise in the darkness, spins, gun drawn. Nobody.  Just the hillocks, stone walls, obstacles.       All surreal in the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuller?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another noise.  Murphy spins left. A gun jambs into the back of his head from the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy.  No accident's okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy drops the gun, holds up his hands.                 Will Fuller shot him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell anyone you were coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin would kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuller laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gonna get us all killed.  He's gone crazy... jumping without a chute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy turns to face Fuller.  Hands still up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first it was some guns and a storage building.  He had signed requisition forms, so it was okay.  But now it's gotten out of control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's expanding.  Shipping merchandise to all of the bases in the United States.  Military transport.  Nobody questions what's inside the boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of the bases?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marines, Army, Navy, and National Guard.  And next week...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they take the amphibious assault vehicles, rocket launchers, and light artillery on manuevers next week... (beat) They'll really be knocking over a Mexican drug lord and hauling all the drugs back onto base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll get caught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No chance of Coast Guard intervention, no customs searches.  These are Marine vehicles on exercises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who signs the requisition forms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've told you too much already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far us does it go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuller looks around.  They're alone in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAM!  Fuller is hit by sniper fire and goes down. Murphy hurls himself to the ground as bullets fly overhea hitting a low stone wall nearby.  He finds his fallen pis and begins crawling to where Fuller lay dying.

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: Bullets fly from three different directions, blasting dir Sending showers of earth over Murphy. Murphy gets to Fuller.  Blood pumps from his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far up does it go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Veillers....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Fuller dies.  Murphy looks at Fuller's corpse. FLASHCUT: Murphy and Ted in Saudi Arabia. Suddenly, a barrage of machinegun fire from the snipers r into the earth around Murphy.  Murphy scrambles away. On the run.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. IRON MAN COURSE
dialogues.text: A SNIPER dressed in camouflage and night vision goggles, watches Murphy scramble away from Fuller's corpse. The Sniper sends a burt of machinegun fire at Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIGHT VISION:  Murphy scrambles deeper into the Iron Man course, trying to escape the sniper's gunfire.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. IRON MAN COURSE
dialogues.text: Murphy is chased by machinegun fire. BING!  A target pops up to his left! Murphy spins and fires at the pop up target. Bullets continue to chase him through the darkness.  He k low as he runs, eyes searching for some sign of the snipe

dialogues.speaker: BING
dialogues.text: A target pop up to his right! Murphy spins and fires.  His foot hits another trigger.

dialogues.speaker: BING
dialogues.text: A target pops up behind him! Murphy spins and fires... Then the target is hit by sniper fire.  Torn to shreds. Murphy hits the dirt, rolls, pops to his feet and runs de into the Iron Man course.  Chased by gun fire. The machinegun fire stops. Murphy is surrounded by noises and echoes.  People moving Fuzzy sounds of radio transmissions between the snipers. Murphy takes a step back.

dialogues.speaker: BING
dialogues.text: A target pops up on either side of him.  He twist and fir hitting both of the targets with head shots. And giving away his position to the snipers. Machinegun fire chases Murphy through the course. Murphy runs around obstacles, over hillocks, jumping ston walls, triggering targets and blowing them away.          Wasting bullets on cardboard men.

dialogues.speaker: BING
dialogues.text: A target pops up behind Murphy, he spins and fires...     CLICK!  Out of shells. Echoes of laughter before the machinegun fire begins, for Murphy to dive behind a crumbled stone wall.  Bullets pep the wall, sending plaster dust into the air like fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy ejects one magazine and rams in a fresh one.       Fifteen shells. The machinegun fire stops. Strange silence.                                          Footsteps?  Rustling?

dialogues.speaker: EXT. IRON MAN COURSE
dialogues.text: TWO SNIPERS in camouflage and night vision goggles, looki like something out of a 50s sci-fi film, search through t course for Murphy. A THIRD SNIPER searches in a different area of the course

dialogues.speaker: EXT. IRON MAN COURSE
dialogues.text: Murphy hears radio fuzz, echoes of words. Footsteps getting closer. Murphy crawls to the end of the stone wall.  Spots a wood fence a hundred feet away.  Makes a break for it.

dialogues.speaker: BING
dialogues.text: A target pops up.  Murphy spins... doesn't fire.

dialogues.speaker: BING
dialogues.text: He triggers three more targets but holds his fire. The targets look at him.  Mute.  Cardboard.  Weird. Murphy makes it to the wood fence.  Catches his breath.  Listens to the radio fuzz, the echoed words.  Footsteps. The next bit of cover: another low stone wall. Murphy rolls from behind the wood fence and starts runnin

dialogues.speaker: BING
dialogues.text: Two targets pop up on either side of Murphy.  He aims at one on the left, holds his fire... Then notices the other target is MOVING! It's one of the SNIPERS bring up his machinegun! Murphy hits the dirt. Machinegun fire flares all around h He rolls to his feet, blasts a couple of shots at the Sni THE SNIPER sends a stream of machinegun fire at Murphy. Murphy dives behind the low stone wall. Bullets rip into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy and the Sniper trade gunfire over the wall. But Murphy is running out of ammo. Lights from over the hillock behind him: The base. Too far to run.  The Sniper would turn him into hamburger Murphy lays behind the wall, listening to the Sniper appr No escape. THE SNIPER moves closer to the stone wall. NIGHT VISION: Can't see Murphy.  Looks all around the wal Maybe he wiggled away. MURPHY notices a target laying flat two dozen feet away. searches the ground for the trigger. Spots it near the ta Gun in one hand, he grabs a loose stone and aims at the trigger mechanism. THE SNIPER creeps closer. MURPHY throws the rock, rolls to his feet, starts running The rock hits the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: BING
dialogues.text: The target pops up behind the Sniper. The Sniper spins and fires, blasting the cardboard soldie to pieces with a blast from his machine gun. By the time he realizes it's a decoy and turns back aroun Murphy is long gone. MURPHY runs down the hillock to the bright lights of the base, gun ready for action.  But he makes it out of the I Man Course before the Snipers can target him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The General Quarters Alarm is sounding, and the base is u and awake.  Marines are confused by the gunfire. As Murphy crosses the base, MARINES yell at each other:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the shooting?  Are we under attack?  What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy holsters his gun, runs to the front gate, hoping t get off the base alive before the Snipers catch up with h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy can see the phone booth in the park across the str

dialogues.speaker: AT THE FRONT GATE
dialogues.text: Murphy gestures to the Gate Officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to get off the base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a gate pass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is an emergency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in the middle of a General Quarters Alarm.  A complete lockdown. We've had reports of gunfire on the base.  Maybe some terrorist thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No pass.  No exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy takes another look at the phone booth in the park. Light on, door open.  Waiting for him.  So close. Murphy looks at his holstered gun.  Gets ready to draw it A pair of MARINE GUARDS jog up to fortify the front gate. Murphy takes his hand away from his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to get General Newhouse's written permission to leave the base until the GQ alert is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy is trapped on the base with the three Snipers. He turns back to the barracks, and the base's pay phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy makes sure Rackin, Delmar, and Horman aren't aroun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy dials General Latimer's private number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone wakes General Latimer up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Latimer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Murphy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost five, sir.  There's been some trouble on the base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've killed the supply sergeant, Fuller.  They're trying to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This gang?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bigger than that.  They're expanding to other bases.  They've got a full scale military assault on some Mexican drug lords next week...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean: Military assault?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have someone in the General's office who can requisition artillery for them.  LAVs, Bradley tanks, AAAVs, everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are any senior officers involved?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe Lt. Veillers is one of them. (beat) Sir, I'd like to take these guys down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sent you in there to prevent a scandal, not start one. (beat) The best way to handle this is to quietly transfer these bad apples to other bases.  Break up the gang.  Then have them dishonorably discharged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I'm in this up to my eyeballs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just back down.  Stop your investigation.  Don't make any waves with General Newhouse.  And whatever you do, don't use my name or call on this line again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, you can't just leave me hanging like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Click.  Dial tone.  Latimer has hung up on him. Murphy stands in the phone booth for a moment.  Alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He quickly dials her number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone rings in the empty apartment.  The bed is still made.  Lucy is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy hangs up.  Then he notices Horman standing on the opposite side of the Parade Grounds watching him. Horman lifts a walkie talkie.  Speaks into it. Murphy checks the magazine of his gun.  A handful of shel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy makes a break for it: racing out of the phone boot to a group of buildings.  Staying in the shadows, hoping elude Horman and the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy hasn't brought his burglar tools.  He tries to pic the lock with his pocket knife, gets nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy KICKS open the door, enters the supply building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy starts grabbing weapons.  Ammo clips for his Beret a huge jungle knife, some grenades, a M249 SAW with an M2 40mm grenade launcher. Gearing up for full scale war. Murphy puts on a flack jacket with pockets and D rings fo the weapons and equipment.  He checks the action on all o the guns.  Satisfied, he gets ready to take on the entire Base if necessary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy steps out of the Supply Building... into an ambush Rackin is on one side of the door, Horman the other.  Bot aim M249 SAW machineguns at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop the SAW, Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Horman nudges him with the barrel of his machinegun, Murphy complies.  He still has his other weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.  Let's go for a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AH-1 Cobra Helicopter lands in front of them.        Murphy sees Lucy in the cockpit, tied up. Delmar has a gun to her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brought your friend.  Thought you'd be happy to see her.  Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy goes to the helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy, Rackin, and Horman climb into the helicopter. When all are onboard, Delmar lifts the Cobra into the air flying high over the city to a stretch of desert. Dawn begins to break behind the helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy leans forward to talk with Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wouldn't hurt Lucy.  She's one of us.  Sergeant Breen's widow.  I thought you knew? (beat) Lucy? You got some 'splaining to do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy is shocked.  Looks at Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magic is stronger than trust.  Stronger than everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy touches Rackin's face.  Rackin smiles at her.  Murph is completely betrayed.  Completely alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no one to turn to.  We're your family.  We're the ones you can trust.  But can we trust you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin opens the side door of the helicopter.  Wind rushe in.  He stands, looking out at the ground far below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're the fucking Marines, Murphy.  We're the best there is.  Only the strong survive.  Are you strong enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I trust you, Murphy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin grabs Murphy's wrist tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're like a brother to me... But are you Cain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment of hesitation, then Murphy grabs Rackin's wrist a fireman's grip.  Holding on to each other's wrists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or Able to hold on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin backs Murphy to the open helicopter door. Delmar tilts the chopper, Murphy falls out the open door. Hanging on to Rackin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy dangles out the helicopter door, holding onto Rack for dear life.  They hold tight to each other, as Murphy tries not to look at the ground a few hundred feet below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what trust is all about.  It comes from the heart.  You have to believe in me.  Believe I won't drop you.  Believe I know what's best for you.  Trust in me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy holds on as the Helicopter continues moving.  The ground, FAR below.  They hang on to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a choice: Keep quiet and live, or let go and die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy holds on, feeling his grip loosening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're on the ground floor, Murphy.  We're expanding our operations.  Taking over all of the drug business on the West Coast. (beat) No one can stop us!  We're the fucking MARINES!  We have tanks!  Choppers!  Harrier jets!  Rocket launchers!  Amphibious Assault Vehicles! (beat) We're an army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin laughs and lets go of Murphy's wrist. Murphy hangs on for his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin turns to Delmar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take us back to the base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy hangs on for dear life as the helicopter turns aro heading back over the city to the base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saudi Arabia.  Desert Storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The General's orders are clear: Pick up survivors and get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy pulls his gun, aims it at the Officer's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck the General.  We going back to pick him up or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not risking my men or my craft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do it myself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Officer turns to the pilot and gestures to lift off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Helicopter begins to lift and fly away.  Ted Newhouse screams in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy!  Murphy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy jambs his gun into the Officer's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck the General.  You're flying back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong.  Get yourself Court Martialed if you want.  I'll give you five minutes.  Then we're out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy nods, holsters his gun, jumps out of the chopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy runs through the gunfire and explosions to where T Newhouse lays... Still alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting you out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy hoists Ted Newhouse onto his shoulders and drag/ca him through the battle field.  Explosions right and left. Ted is heavy, slowing Murphy down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A voice on the Officer's radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobra Zero Seven, what is your status?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiting at extraction point Alpha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your hold up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunnery Sergeant Murphy asked us to wait five minutes for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take orders from Gunnery Sergeants, Mr. Mainwarring?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir, but he said...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give the orders.  Return to base immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Officer turns to the Pilot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard the man. (beat) Let's get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter lifts off... Just as Murphy and Ted enter the clearing.  The Helicopte leaves them behind.  Behind enemy lines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nooooooooooooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter zooms away in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy hangs on to Rackin's wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nooooooooooooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls himself inside the helicopter, using Rackin's ar like a rope, and the chopper strut as a step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy climbs into the helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin SLAMS a fist into Murphy's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter zooms back to San Diego and the Base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin draws his side arm, and Murphy knocks it from his hands.  Rackin slams Murphy in the face again. Horman enters the fight, slamming Murphy with both fists. Murphy fights Horman and Rackin in the helicopter, trying stay away from the open door... and a fall to the city be A SAVAGE hand to hand fight.  Kicking, hitting, gouging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could have been one of us, Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin knocks him to the open doors.  Murphy almost falls out!  Catches the edge of the door, hangs in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at them down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin connects with Murphy's nose, breaking it.  Murphy almost goes out the doors, but ducks the next punch and scrambles back inside the chopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Millions of people, all want their smack.  We can't stop them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horman SLAMS him in the back of the head.  No way for Mur to fight both of them and survive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can only supply them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin does a one-two combination on Murphy's gut. Murphy is fading fast.  He has to do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter zooms over the far end of the base, headed towards the Iron Man Course and the Parade Ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin SLAMS Murphy in the head. Horman grabs his Beretta hand gun and presses it against Murphy's eye.  Finger ready to pull the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you see there's no choice, Murphy?  You failed the test.  Now you have to pay the penalty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy ducks quickly and the shot goes wild. Horman gets ready to fire again.  Murphy grabs his gun ha They wrestle for control of the gun, as Rackin tries to S Murphy again with his fists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pass or fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horman gets ready to fire again.  Murphy yanks on his gun hand, throwing Horman off balance... And out of the helicopter doors!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horman falls all the way to the Iron Man Course.  SPLAT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy continues to fight with Rackin.  When the helicopt changes angle, Rackin's gun slides to Lucy, who picks it She aims the gun at the two fighting men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't get a clean shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy pushes Rackin away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Rackin and Murphy momentarily separated, Lucy can ge clean shot.  She aims, pulls the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: The bullet just misses Murphy's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delmar takes the helicopter lower, thirty feet off the Ir Man Course.  They zip along, headed to the Parade Grounds

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy re-aims at Murphy's head.  Ready to pull the trigger Murphy looks at the open door at the earth thirty feet be Jumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy jumps out of the helicopter, hits the dirt and rol to his feet.  Back on the damned Base!

dialogues.speaker: EXT. IRON MAN COURSE
dialogues.text: Murphy runs through the Ironman Course to the barracks.

dialogues.speaker: ROAR
dialogues.text: The helicopter zooms down at him, like the crop duster in "North By Northwest".                                     Man versus machine. Murphy dives, chopper ROARS overhead, almost clipping him THE HELICOPTER zooms over the Iron Man Course. Murphy scrambles to his feet, running for a stone fence a hundred feet away.  Around him, the tattered remains of t pop up targets, blown to pieces only hours ago. Faces torn to shreds, but still staring at him. THE HELICOPTER banks.... ......................turns....                       .............................And comes roaring down at Mu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin leans out the open door, spraying machinegun fire.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. IRON MAN COURSE
dialogues.text: Murphy dives to the ground as bullets spatter around him. The chopper almost clips him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delmar pulls back on the stick seconds before the skids w have hit the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost got him.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. IRON MAN COURSE
dialogues.text: When the chopper zooms away, Murphy gets to his feet and runs like hell for the end of the course. THE HELICOPTER turns around, ROARS after him. Murphy races for the next cover, the helicopter closes in Machinegun fire spray around Murphy.  He dives for the wo fence, and it is turned into sawdust. Murphy pulls out his 9mm and waits for the helicopter to zoom close before firing a couple of shots at it. THE HELICOPTER zooms away, banks, and comes back for anot attack.  Rackin ready with the machinegun. Murphy takes off running. The chopper right behind him, roaring only a few feet beh Murphy dives for the next piece of cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin blasts away at Murphy, shredding a couple of pop u targets.  But as soon as the helicopter gets close, Murph opens fire with his hand gun. Bullets almost hitting Rackin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up!  Get up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delmar lifts the helicopter, zooming away.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. IRON MAN COURSE
dialogues.text: When Murphy gets to his feet, the helicopter is on him ag Rackin fires at Murphy, bullets ricocheting off targets. Murphy runs across the course, the chopper in hot pursuit Murphy takes a left, then a right.  Trying to lose the helicopter.  No luck.  It sticks to him like glue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE HELICOPTER zooms behind him, banking for left and rig turns.  Rackin holding on, as he fires at Murphy. Murphy takes a right, sees another stone wall. He runs for it at top speed. THE HELICOPTER roars behind him... closing the gap.  At t stone wall, Murphy dives for the ground. When the helicopter zooms overhead (only inches away!) Mu opens fire, aiming at the fuel tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullets pierce the fuel tank, spraying orange fuel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been hit.  Losing fuel fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta take her down.  Now!

dialogues.speaker: EXT. IRON MAN COURSE
dialogues.text: Murphy watches as the helicopter zooms away, heading to a landing area near the motor pool.  Murphy pops to his fee and starts running to the General's Office.  Safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marines get out of Murphy's way.  He looks like a mad man Cut up, beat up, bloody, carrying a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy makes to Newhouse's office Building without being caught by Delmar or Rackin. He holsters his pistol, and scrambles inside before they catch him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy slams the door behind him, looks at the creepy Lt. Veillers, who sits between him and the General.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to see General Newhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The General is busy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about the shooting this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Veillers studies Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (threatening) I don't think you should bother him with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not leaving 'til I talk with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I call the MPs?  Have you arrested?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy starts to the General's Office, but Veillers block his way.  Trying to push him back to the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't let you talk with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know what you're doing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're Rackin's inside man, Veillers.  But if you let me past I won't squeal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Veillers pushes harder, fighting with Murphy.  Violent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't go in there. (beat) I won't let you past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy takes out his gun and clubs Veillers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.  I'll find my own way in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy steps over him and enters General Newhouse's Offic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newhouse looks up at Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I'd like to report some criminal activity on the base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have time for this bullshit, Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I realize you don't like me, but I believe this is a situation where we'll benefit from working together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I want to help the man who killed my son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy is compelled to tell the truth for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't kill your son, sir.  I carried him on my back for twelve miles after you ordered the helicopter back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newhouse shows shock and anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'd been shot twice.  Might have lived with medical attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You left him to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I carried him as long as I could.  He was already dead when I finally laid him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy pulls out his dog tags, takes off Ted Newhouse's tarnished tag and hands it to Newhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now will you help me?  Will you listen to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newhouse looks at the dog tag in his hand.  His son's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an organized gang on the base. Run by Gunnery Sergeant Marty Rackin.  They're using equipment, weapons, and supplies to take over the drug business on the West Coast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went along on one of their Midnight Raids.  Civilians were killed, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe this could happen here.  The Marine Corps is based on a chain of command.  Respect for superior officers.  Following orders. (beat) How could one man disobey so many orders that it came to this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin stands in the doorway, aiming his SAW at Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gave him a chance, but he's just not a good soldier.  Won't do what he's told.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delmar enters and steps up to Murphy, nudging the back of his head with his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop it, jackass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy drops his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant Delmar, make sure Corporal Murphy is involved in a training accident.  A fatal one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delmar nudges Murphy out the door.  To his death. Newhouse looks from the corroded dog tag up to Rackin.  H tone with Rackin is paternal, as if Rackin had been caugh TPing the neighbor's house... not trying to kill Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty, how could you let it go this far?  It's completely out of control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir.  I thought I could trust him.  But he ended up being a rat.  You know how much I hate rats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The base is on full alert.  Everyone heard the shooting. (beat) There'll probably be an investigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could say we were running a night training exercise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stern) You should have come to me first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin nods.  General Newhouse may want to punish him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir.  It won't happen again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newhouse nods, looks back down at the dog tag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Quigley Course. Delmar prods Murphy out to the middle of the woods near t muddy ditch with the barrel of his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a good place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delmar presses the gun into the back of Murphy's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.  Sorry it didn't work out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delmar's finger tightens on the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: Murphy ducks, spins and knocks the gun from Delmar's hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You son of a bitch.  Could have been painless.  Could have been easy.  But you want to do it the hard way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy prepares to fight the brute. It's a battle of the titans. A true fight to the death. Delmar pulls out a HUGE jungle knife and attacks before M can get to his own knife. DELMAR AND MURPHY fight hand to knife. The blade striking out again and again at Murphy.         Murphy evades it and lands a punch on Delmar's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is kind of fun, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delmar stabs down at Murphy's neck. Murphy has no choice but to GRAB THE KNIFE BLADE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AGHHH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blade cuts into his fingers and palm as Murphy pushes away, then rolls away.  Delmar gets ready to strike again SPINNING, Murphy kicks the knife out of Delmar's hands.

dialogues.speaker: WHACK
dialogues.text: THE KNIFE sticks into a nearby tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it's even.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delmar attacks, fighting Murphy hand to hand.  The two ki parry, and thrust.  Feet and hands slamming into each oth chest with enough force to send them sprawling. Murphy hits the ground, rolls to his feet to attack. Delmar is ready, blocks the punch. He slams Murphy with his elbow.  HARD. Murphy almost goes down.

dialogues.speaker: SLAM
dialogues.text: Murphy lands three hits in a row, forcing Delmar backward

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delmar laughs it off and charges. He slams against Murphy and both go hurling backwards to a tree. Delmar slams Murphy's head repeatedly against the tree. Murphy reaches up... fingers touching the knife.  He pull it out of the tree and STABS at Delmar. Delmar lets go of Murphy and pulls the knife from his che

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not enough force.  You must have missed the day we learned how to use a knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds it up and SNAPS it in half, throwing the pieces away.  Then he charges Murphy again. Murphy steps away from the tree at the last moment, and D SLAMS into it.  Falls to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't miss the tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy moves in for the kill, but Delmar rolls away. Delmar rolls onto his feet, and gestures for Murphy to co forward and fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready to give up?  I'll kill you quickly.  Put you out of our misery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy moves in and they resume their fight. Kicking, chopping, hitting, flipping, rolling, and punchi Murphy continues landing hits, but Delmar won't go down. DELMAR AND MURPHY continue fighting around the Quigley Co each one landing impressive hits on the other. But Delmar doesn't feel the hits like Murphy.  Murphy is taking a beating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way you can win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I give up, there's no way I win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy lands three good hits in a row, sending Delmar bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delmar hits a tree, then bounces back to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been fun, but now it's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delmar gets ready to kill Murphy with a final attack. Murphy isn't sure he can take another full attack.

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: Delmar slams into Murphy and the two fight. Delmar keeps forcing Murphy towards the razor wire. Murphy finds himself pushes back to the edge of the wire. Back hitting the barbs with no place else to go. Murphy takes hit after hit.  He finally spins, landing tw good hits on Delmar that force the brute against the wire Delmar gets tangled in the razor wire.  The more he tries dig out of it, the more it digs into him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't fight it and win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delmar roars to his feet, dragging a few yards of coiled razor wire behind him, and CHARGES AT MURPHY! If Murphy gets tangles in the razor wire, it's over. Murphy goes for his gun... But the flap is snapped.  He scrambles backwards, trying to free his weapon. Trips over a log and goes down. Delmar The Razor Man rushes at him. Murphy fumbles with his gun.  Delmar getting closer.  He gets the gun out.  Gets it up.  Delmar ON TOP OF HIM.

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: Blasts Delmar right off his feet.  The brute falls dead o inches away from tangling up Murphy. Murphy stops to take a breath. Delmar GRABS HIS LEG.  Start pulling himself closer! Murphy gives him a kick in the face, then scrambles away. Delmar is too tangled to crawl, and dies. Murphy holsters his gun and runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy runs across the Parade Grounds to the phone booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy gets to the phone, closes the door behind him.  Sa He digs in his pocket for change. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picks up the phone and hits "0".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Operator, I'd like to make a collect call to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone booth door pops open and a pair of MARINES grab him and yank him out.  One is the Gate Officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy struggles with the Marines, but they control him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The General wants to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two Marines begin dragging Murphy to the General's Of Murphy struggles but can't get away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, there's some kind of mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Corporal Murphy.  That's who the General wants to see.  No mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other Marine takes his side arm and all of his weapon Disarming Murphy... except for the grenades on his vest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to get off the base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have my orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are people trying to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Officer turns to the other Marine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's stewed now.  Can you believe it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.  They found the smack in your bunk.  Along with some burglar tools and paraphernalia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closer to the General's Office.  Murphy HAS to get away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is at the front gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a guy covering it for me.  So, how long you been riding the horse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See.  No track marks on my arms...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you shoot up between your toes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a junkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why we have Court Martial proceedings.  So you can state your case.  Give your evidence. (beat) Though that smack kit they found in your bunk is going to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy twists right, then left, knocking the two away.  H takes off running.  Racing across the base to the front g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy gets to the front gates, sees a Marine with his ba turned in the Gate Officer's kiosk and pleads his case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This may not make any sense, but you have to help me.  There are some officers on the base who are trying to kill me.  I have to get off the base NOW.  I don't have any pass, but if you'll call General Latimer at Fort Lejuene, he can straighten this all out.  Just let me out now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Marine in the kiosk finally turns around: It's Rackin Rackin steps out of the kiosk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So.  You're Latimer's snitch.  And I thought you were my friend.  All of that was bullshit, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over, Marty.  Too much shooting.  No way to cover it all up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll find away.  I'm the magic man.  It'll all disappear in the paperwork. Just like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin pulls the M249 SAW machinegun from the counter beh him with a flourish.  Aims it at Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin's finger tightens on the trigger. Murphy tackles Rackin to the ground. The gun discharges but misses, tearing the kiosk to shred

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're good Murphy.  One of you is worth as dozen Artie Hormans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stream of hot brass hits Murphy in the face, burning hi He screams in pain. THE TWO MEN STRUGGLE WITH THE GUN BETWEEN THEM. Rackin aims the gun at Murphy to fire again, but Murphy i on top of him before he can pull the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We would have made a great team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy grabs the gun and twists it up into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're not much of a team player, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gun explodes between the two, sending a stream of hot lead inches between their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Missed.  Wanna try again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin pushes the gun barrel around until it's aimed at Murphy's face.  His finger starts to squeeze. Murphy pushes the barrel away from him. Rackin presses the hot gun barrel into Murphy's forehead. Murphy screams as the hot barrel burns his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Play as a team, we can win as a team.  But you're too much of a loner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy presses the barrel towards Rackin and presses Rack trigger finger. A STREAM OF GUNFIRE misses Rackin by a hair.  Rackin laug and twists the gun back around to aim at Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You left the General's son to die.  You know how much that hurt him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy pushes up on the barrel.

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: Bullets and flames fill the space between the two as they continue struggling for control of the machinegun.        Each one pressing the barrel towards the other's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That man's like a father to me, Murphy.  When they were going to Double D me, he stood up for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy looks down the gun barrel and sees Rackin squeezin the trigger.  He KICKS up, hitting Rackin in the groin. When Rackin doubles over in pain, Murphy twists the gun a to aim at Rackin's chest and presses his trigger finger. Click!                                                    Out of shells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin lets go of the gun, laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want the gun, take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM!  He slams the machinegun into Rackin's face. Rackin and Murphy wrestle to the ground, fighting hand to hand.  Rolling, gouging, head butting.  They end up at th gate, slamming against the chain link.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  What have we here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin sticks his fingers through the pins on Murphy's grenades, pulls his hand away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With these rings, I make thee dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rackin scrambles to the kiosk. Murphy looks down as the live grenades fall from his vest the pavement.  He wipes his hand across them... rolling t across the drive to the kiosk. RACKIN sees the grenades rolling at him and tries scrambl away... but is trapped in the kiosk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noooooooooooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy dives behind a stone wall.

dialogues.speaker: THE KIOSK AND FRONT GATES EXPLODE
dialogues.text: A huge fireball, raining debris down over Murphy.         Rocking the entire base with its concussion. Murphy gets to his feet, looks from the blasted open fron gate (escape) to the General's Office across the base. Makes a decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newhouse is looking at the dog tag in his hand, and a fra photo of TED on the desk.  Remembering the past, and past mistakes.  His gun is on his desk. All of Murphy's belongings are stacked by the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heard you wanted to see me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newhouse looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Martin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead.  So're Delmar and Horman.  It's over General.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldn't let it go, could you? First you kill my son...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't kill Ted.  You did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saudi Arabia. War.  The helicopter waits for Murphy and T A voice on the Officer's radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobra Zero Seven, what is your status?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiting at extraction point Alpha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What your hold up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunnery Sergeant Murphy asked us to wait five minutes for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other side of the conversation, from a radio room set in a tent a few miles from the enemy lines.  All we see i the radio, and several other Marines (including Veillers) the background.  The "VOICE" is revealed at the scene's e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take orders from Gunnery Sergeants, Mr. Mainwarring?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir, but he said...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give the orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We dolly around until we see the "VOICE"s face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Return to base immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Newhouse lowers the mike.  Veillers tries to spea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a chain of command in this service.  It is to be followed link by link.  When I give an order, it is to be carried out to the letter.  Does everyone here understand that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newhouse puts his hand on top of his gun, looks at Murphy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I loved the Corps so much that I gave it my only son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lifts the gun.                                         Murphy spots his stack of belongings by the door. On top, his Beretta 9mm automatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After Ted's death, I was depressed.  Thought of killing myself. (beat) Then I was transferred here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newhouse looks at his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Met Marty.  Took him under my wing.  Thought I'd turn him into a Marine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gun shifts towards Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he was wild.  Uncontrollable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy inches towards his foot locker and gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Called himself the magic man.  He even tricked me.  I covered up his little messes.  Running whores on the base.  Running drugs on the base. (beat) The man was like a son to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newhouse shifts the gun, aiming it at himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just got out of control.  There was no way to stop Rackin's crazy schemes without implicating myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When something is wrong, General, you fix it.  No matter the price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would have been the end of my career.  The end of my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have court martialed Rackin when you had the chance.  You should have done what's right.  You're what's wrong with this base, General.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy grabs the phone on Newhouse's desk and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Latimer, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newhouse drops his gun and hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't let you do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see any other choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newhouse grabs his gun off the desk, twists it around to at himself, ready to commit suicide.                     Then has a better idea:  Aims at Murphy and fires. Murphy dives for his gun, grabs it, rolls to his feet. Murphy and Newhouse square off for a second like gunfight at high noon.  Aiming at each other.  Looking in each oth eyes.  Waiting for the other to move first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newhouse and Murphy fire at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: Murphy gets hit in the shoulder, goes down. Newhouse gets hit in the chest, slams back against the wa As Newhouse lays dying on the floor his fingers reach for the dog tag on the floor a few feet away. Stretching. Getting closer. Closer. Fingers almost touching the memory of his son. Then he dies, without ever touching it. Murphy staggers to his feet, just as the MPs and Veillers storm into the General's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The exploded front gates.  Fires still burning. The place is a war zone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shots of the destruction at the base on CNN News.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four men were killed in a daring terrorist attack on a United States Marine Base.  These are not the first Marines to die at the hands of Terrorists.  In October of 1983, two hundred and thirty seven Marines were killed in Beirut as the result of a terrorist bombing.  More recently...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE TV STATION CLICKS TO ANOTHER CHANNEL: Same news. We see the PRESIDENT in the Rose Garden (stock footage?).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a special memorial ceremony today in the White House Rose Garden, the President awarded medals to the brave Marines killed in the terrorist attack against Camp Richards in San Diego. (beat) The Congressional Medal Of Honor was awarded to Corporal Arthur Horman of Key Largo, Florida...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A photo of Artie Horman, as the medal is layed on top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant David Delmar, of Phoenix City, Arizona...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Photo of Delmar as the medal is layed on top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunnery Sergeant Martin L. Rackin of Detroit, Michigan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Photo of Rackin as the medal is layed on top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a special Medal Of Honor to General Anthony Newhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last medal is placed on Newhouse's photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy turns away from the cell's TV set and yells at the GUARD outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Can you turn this damned TV off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV screen goes dark, and Murphy sits on his bunk, loo through the bars, waiting for his court martial.
